marketplaces.name: my-gg-plugins
marketplaces.description: Personal Claude Code toolkit curated from GGPrompts
marketplaces.repo_description: My Claude Code plugin marketplace - skills, agents, hooks, commands

files..claude-plugin/marketplace.json:
{
  "$schema": "https://cdn.anthropic.com/schemas/claude-code/marketplace-plugin.schema.json",
  "name": "my-gg-plugins",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "Personal Claude Code toolkit curated from GGPrompts",
  "owner": {
    "name": "matt",
    "email": "matt@ggprompts.com"
  },
  "plugins": [
    {
      "name": "ui-styling",
      "description": "Create beautiful, accessible user interfaces with shadcn/ui components, Tailwind CSS, and canvas-based visual designs",
      "version": "1.0.0",
      "source": "./plugins/ui-styling",
      "strict": false,
      "keywords": ["ui", "tailwind", "shadcn", "design"]
    },
    {
      "name": "skill-creator",
      "description": "Guide for creating effective skills that extend Claude's capabilities with specialized knowledge and workflows",
      "version": "1.0.0",
      "source": "./plugins/skill-creator",
      "strict": false,
      "keywords": ["meta", "skills", "development"]
    },
    {
      "name": "bubbletea",
      "description": "Build terminal user interfaces with Go and Bubbletea framework - TUI apps, Elm architecture, Lipgloss styling",
      "version": "1.0.0",
      "source": "./plugins/bubbletea",
      "strict": false,
      "keywords": ["go", "tui", "terminal", "bubbletea"]
    },
    {
      "name": "agent-creator",
      "description": "Guide for creating effective Claude Code agents with system prompts, tool restrictions, and MCP integrations",
      "version": "1.0.0",
      "source": "./plugins/agent-creator",
      "strict": false,
      "keywords": ["meta", "agents", "development"]
    },
    {
      "name": "docker-mcp",
      "description": "Comprehensive guide for Docker MCP Toolkit - discover and use ~170 MCP servers on-demand",
      "version": "1.0.0",
      "source": "./plugins/docker-mcp",
      "strict": false,
      "keywords": ["mcp", "docker", "integrations"]
    },
    {
      "name": "xterm-js",
      "description": "Battle-tested patterns for xterm.js terminal implementations and React-based terminal applications",
      "version": "1.0.0",
      "source": "./plugins/xterm-js",
      "strict": false,
      "keywords": ["terminal", "xterm", "react", "websocket"]
    },
    {
      "name": "ai-multimodal",
      "description": "Process multimedia with Google Gemini - audio analysis, image understanding, video processing, document extraction",
      "version": "1.0.0",
      "source": "./plugins/ai-multimodal",
      "strict": false,
      "keywords": ["gemini", "multimodal", "audio", "video", "images"]
    },
    {
      "name": "docs-seeker",
      "description": "Search for technical documentation using llms.txt standard, GitHub repos via Repomix, and parallel exploration",
      "version": "1.0.0",
      "source": "./plugins/docs-seeker",
      "strict": false,
      "keywords": ["documentation", "search", "llms-txt"]
    },
    {
      "name": "web-frameworks",
      "description": "Build full-stack web apps with Next.js App Router, Turborepo monorepos, and RemixIcon",
      "version": "1.0.0",
      "source": "./plugins/web-frameworks",
      "strict": false,
      "keywords": ["nextjs", "react", "turborepo", "web"]
    },
    {
      "name": "canvas-design",
      "description": "Create beautiful visual art in PNG and PDF using design philosophy - posters, artwork, static designs",
      "version": "1.0.0",
      "source": "./plugins/canvas-design",
      "strict": false,
      "keywords": ["design", "canvas", "art", "visual"]
    },
    {
      "name": "problem-solving",
      "description": "Collection of problem-solving techniques: meta-pattern recognition, collision-zone thinking, scale game, inversion",
      "version": "1.1.0",
      "source": "./plugins/problem-solving",
      "strict": false,
      "keywords": ["thinking", "problem-solving", "techniques"]
    },
    {
      "name": "debugging",
      "description": "Systematic debugging skills: root cause tracing, defense-in-depth validation, verification before completion",
      "version": "2.1.0",
      "source": "./plugins/debugging",
      "strict": false,
      "keywords": ["debugging", "troubleshooting", "verification"]
    },
    {
      "name": "prompt-engineer",
      "description": "Interactive prompt refinement with best practices and clipboard copy",
      "version": "1.0.0",
      "source": "./plugins/prompt-engineer",
      "strict": false,
      "keywords": ["prompts", "engineering", "interactive"]
    },
    {
      "name": "handoff",
      "description": "Generate a handoff summary and copy to clipboard for continuing in new sessions",
      "version": "1.0.0",
      "source": "./plugins/handoff",
      "strict": false,
      "keywords": ["workflow", "handoff", "context"]
    },
    {
      "name": "wipe",
      "description": "Generate handoff, clear context, and auto-continue in fresh session",
      "version": "1.0.0",
      "source": "./plugins/wipe",
      "strict": false,
      "keywords": ["workflow", "context", "reset"]
    },
    {
      "name": "gemini",
      "description": "Query Google Gemini for root cause analysis (read-only, no edits)",
      "version": "1.0.0",
      "source": "./plugins/gemini",
      "strict": false,
      "keywords": ["gemini", "analysis", "debugging"]
    },
    {
      "name": "codex",
      "description": "Query OpenAI Codex for root cause analysis (read-only, no edits)",
      "version": "1.0.0",
      "source": "./plugins/codex",
      "strict": false,
      "keywords": ["codex", "analysis", "debugging"]
    },
    {
      "name": "validate-plan",
      "description": "Project Plan Validation & Enrichment System",
      "version": "1.0.0",
      "source": "./plugins/validate-plan",
      "strict": false,
      "keywords": ["planning", "validation", "workflow"]
    },
    {
      "name": "pmux",
      "description": "Interactive Prompt Engineer with tmux send-keys - directly send prompts to Claude Code sessions",
      "version": "1.0.0",
      "source": "./plugins/pmux",
      "strict": false,
      "keywords": ["tmux", "prompts", "interactive"]
    },
    {
      "name": "pmux2",
      "description": "Interactive Prompt Engineer with tmux send-keys - v2 with improvements",
      "version": "1.0.0",
      "source": "./plugins/pmux2",
      "strict": false,
      "keywords": ["tmux", "prompts", "interactive"]
    },
    {
      "name": "mcp-manager",
      "description": "Manage MCP server integrations - discover tools/prompts/resources, analyze relevance, execute capabilities",
      "version": "1.0.0",
      "source": "./plugins/mcp-manager",
      "strict": false,
      "keywords": ["mcp", "agents", "integrations"]
    }
  ]
}

marketplaces.name: tabz-beads
marketplaces.description: Claude Code orchestration plugin - multi-session workflows via beads issue tracking
marketplaces.repo_description: Conductor plugin for orchestrating multi-session Claude development with beads

files.README.md:
# TabzBeads - Plugin Marketplace for Claude Code

A collection of plugins for development workflows, browser automation, and multi-session orchestration.

## Features

- **Prefix taxonomy**: `bd-` (user commands), `bdc-` (conductor skills), `bdw-` (worker skills)
- **Beads integration**: AI-native issue tracking with `bd` CLI
- **Multi-session orchestration**: Spawn parallel workers via TabzChrome
- **Auto-discovered skills**: Commands in `commands/`, internal skills in `skills/`

## Quick Start

```bash
# User entry points (commands)
/conductor:bd-start [issue-id]  # Single-session: you do the work (no spawn)
/conductor:bd-plan              # Prepare backlog
/conductor:bd-conduct           # Interactive orchestration (1-4 workers)
/conductor:bd-auto              # Fully autonomous (all ready, no prompts)
/conductor:bd-status            # View issue state
/conductor:bd-new-project       # Project scaffolding
```

## Installation

```bash
./install.sh
```

## Documentation

- [Conductor Workflows](docs/conductor-workflows.md) - Complete workflow reference
- [CLAUDE.md](CLAUDE.md) - Project structure and patterns
files.plugins/conductor/README.md:
# Conductor Plugin

Multi-session orchestration for Claude Code with beads-native issue tracking.

## Overview

The Conductor plugin enables parallel Claude Code workflows through:
- **Worker spawning** via TabzChrome terminals
- **Beads integration** for issue tracking and state management
- **Wave-based execution** for parallel task processing
- **Automated code review** and completion pipelines

## Installation

```bash
# Clone TabzBeads marketplace
git clone https://github.com/GGPrompts/TabzBeads.git

# Copy to Claude plugins
cp -r TabzBeads/plugins/conductor ~/.claude/plugins/
```

Or add to your `.claude/plugins/` symlink path.

## Commands

Commands are workflow steps invoked with `/conductor:*` prefix.

### User Entry Points (bd-*)
| Command | Purpose |
|---------|---------|
| `bd-plan` | Prepare backlog: refine, enhance prompts, match skills |
| `bd-start` | Work directly on an issue (no spawn) |
| `bd-status` | View issue state (open, blocked, ready) |
| `bd-conduct` | Interactive orchestration: select issues, terminals (1-4), mode |
| `bd-auto` | Fully autonomous: all ready issues, no prompts |
| `bd-new-project` | Template-based project scaffolding |

### Conductor Internal (bdc-*)
| Command | Purpose |
|---------|---------|
| `bdc-orchestration` | Multi-session coordination |
| `bdc-swarm-auto` | Autonomous waves until backlog empty |
| `bdc-wave-done` | Merge branches, unified review, cleanup |
| `bdc-visual-qa` | Visual QA between waves |
| `bdc-run-wave` | Run wave from template |
| `bdc-prompt-enhancer` | Enhance issue prompts with context |
| `bdc-analyze-transcripts` | Review worker session transcripts |

### Worker Steps (bdw-*)
| Command | Purpose |
|---------|---------|
| `bdw-verify-build` | Run build and report errors |
| `bdw-run-tests` | Run tests if available |
| `bdw-code-review` | Sonnet review, worker applies fixes |
| `bdw-codex-review` | Cost-effective read-only review via OpenAI Codex |
| `bdw-commit-changes` | Stage + commit with conventional format |
| `bdw-close-issue` | Close a beads issue |
| `bdw-create-followups` | Create follow-up beads issues |
| `bdw-update-docs` | Update README, CHANGELOG, CLAUDE.md |
| `bdw-worker-init` | Initialize worker context |
| `bdw-worker-done` | Full completion pipeline |

## Skills

Skills provide reference knowledge (naturally invoked, no prefix needed).

| Skill | Purpose |
|-------|---------|
| `tabz-mcp` | Browser automation MCP reference (70 tools) |
| `terminal-tools` | tmux and TUI tool control reference |

## Agents

| Agent | Purpose |
|-------|---------|
| `conductor` | Main orchestrator for multi-session workflows |
| `code-reviewer` | Read-only Sonnet code review |
| `skill-picker` | Find and install skills from skillsmp.com |
| `silent-failure-hunter` | Error handling audit |

## Scripts

| Script | Purpose |
|--------|---------|
| `setup-worktree.sh` | Git worktree creation |
| `match-skills.sh` | Issue-to-skill matching |
| `lookahead-enhancer.sh` | Parallel prompt preparation |
| `completion-pipeline.sh` | Automated wave completion |
| `wave-summary.sh` | Generate wave summaries |
| `capture-session.sh` | Capture session transcripts |
| `discover-skills.sh` | Runtime skill discovery |

## Workflow Example

```bash
# 1. Check available work
bd ready

# 2. Start interactive orchestration
/conductor:bd-conduct

# 3. Select issues, terminal count, mode
# Workers spawn and execute in parallel

# 4. When workers complete, conductor merges and reviews
/conductor:bdc-wave-done V4V-abc V4V-def
```

## Requirements

- Claude Code with Task tool
- beads CLI (`bd`) for issue tracking
- TabzChrome for terminal spawning (optional)
- tmux for session management

## License

MIT License - see LICENSE file

plugins.description: Multi-session orchestration - beads workflows, parallel workers, visual QA via tabz-expert, completion pipelines
